description: In terms of freedoms, the Burkinabe government has implemented the establishment of a curfew from 7:00 pm to 5:00 am throughout the nation, starting at midnight on March 21, 2020.
The Burkinabe Council declared a state of health alert in accordance with Article 66 of the Public Health Code.
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Military,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description: The Burkinabe president announced the closure of the Ouagadougou and Bob-Dioulasso airports to commercial flight for a period of 2 weeks, renewable, from March 21 at midnight; this measure does not apply to domestic and military flights and cargo.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: The Burkinabe government announced the closure of all land and rail borders, for a period of two weeks, renewable, starting at midnight on 21 March 2020, except for freight.
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Burkina Faso's Ministry of Industry, Trade and Handicrafts has set maximum prices for hydroalcoholic gels and solutions and respiratory protection masks in Burkina Faso, to be fixed for a period of 6 months from March 25, 2020.

description: The Burkinabe Ministry in charge of Research announced on March 26, the launch of two clinical trials of Chloroquine-Azitromycin and Apivirine, a drug produced in Benin and used in the treatment of HIV-AIDS, will also be tested.

description: The wearing of masks or nose-masks will be mandatory from 27 April 2020, throughout the national territory in Burkina Faso.

description: Demonstrations and/or gatherings of people in places and/or venues open to the public have been banned in the Centre region, including the organization of baptisms, weddings (official, religious, traditional) and any other event involving the public from March 25 to April 20, 2020.
